behaviors.name: Macro Pause For Release
behaviors.description: Macro Pause Until Release Marker

behaviors.description: Macro Parameter One Substituted into Next Binding's First Parameter

behaviors.name: Macro Parameter 1 to 2
behaviors.description: Macro Parameter One Substituted into Next Binding's Second Parameter

behaviors.name: Macro Parameter 2 to 1

behaviors.name: Macro Parameter 2 to 2

behaviors.name: Transparent
behaviors.description: The Transparent behavior simply ignores key position presses/releases, so they will be passed down to the next active layer in the stack.

behaviors.name: None
behaviors.description: The None behavior simply swallows and stops key position presses/releases, so they will not be passed down to the next active layer in the stack.

behaviors.name: Key Press
behaviors.description: The Key Press behavior sends standard keycodes on press/release.\nIf you want to output modifier+keycode combinations, you can use modifier functions such as LG (for left GUI), LA (for left alt), LS (for left shift), LC (for left control), and the right equivalents.

behaviors.name: Caps Word
behaviors.description: The Caps Word behavior behaves similar to a caps lock, but will automatically deactivate when any key not in a continue list is pressed, or if the caps word key is pressed again.

behaviors.name: Key Repeat
behaviors.description: The Key Repeat behavior when triggered will send whatever keycode was last sent/triggered.

behaviors.name: Key Toggle
behaviors.description: The Key Toggle behavior toggles the press of a key. If the key is not currently pressed, key toggle will press it, holding it until the key toggle is pressed again or the key is released in some other way. If the key is currently pressed, key toggle will release it.

behaviors.name: Layer Tap
behaviors.description: The Layer-Tap behavior enables a layer when a key is held, and outputs a keypress when the key is only tapped for a short time.

behaviors.name: Momentary Layer
behaviors.description: The Momentary Layer behavior enables a layer while a certain key is pressed. Immediately upon activation of the key, the layer is enabled, and immediately upon release of the key, the layer is disabled again.

behaviors.name: Mod Tap
behaviors.description: The Mod-Tap behavior sends a different keypress, depending on whether it's held or tapped. If you hold the key for longer than 200ms, the first keycode is sent. If you tap the key (release before 200ms), the second keycode is sent. If you press another key within the 200ms, the 'mod' behavior is also activated.

behaviors.name: Sticky Key
behaviors.description: A Sticky Key stays pressed until another key is pressed. It is often used for 'sticky shift'. By using a sticky shift, you don't have to hold the shift key to write a capital.

behaviors.name: Sticky Layer
behaviors.description: A Sticky Layer stays pressed until another key is pressed. By using a sticky layer, you don't have to hold the layer key to access a layer. Instead, tap the sticky layer key to activate the layer until the next keypress.

behaviors.name: To Layer
behaviors.description: The To Layer behavior enables a layer and disables all other layers except the default layer.

behaviors.name: Toggle Layer
behaviors.description: The Toggle Layer behavior enables a layer until the layer is manually disabled.

behaviors.name: Bluetooth
behaviors.description: The Bluetooth behavior allows management of various settings and states related to the bluetooth connection(s) between the keyboard and the host.

commands.description: Clear bond information between the keyboard and host for the selected profile.
Clear bond information between the keyboard and host for *all* profiles.
Switch to the next profile, cycling through to the first one when the end is reached.
Switch to the previous profile, cycling through to the last one when the beginning is reached.

[Beta-PR25 and newer] Disconnect from the 0-indexed profile by number, if it's currently connected and inactive. Please note: this definition must include a number as an argument in the keymap to work correctly. eg. \`BT_DISC 0\`

Do not use this unless you are defining a macro; use &bt_0 to &bt_3 instead. Select the 0-indexed profile by number. Please note: this definition must include a number as an argument in the keymap to work correctly. eg. BT_SEL 0

behaviors.name: Bluetooth Profile 0
behaviors.description: Single quick tap to select the BT profile 0.\nDouble tap to disconnect BT profile 0.

behaviors.name: Bluetooth Profile 1
behaviors.description: Single quick tap to select the BT profile 1.\nDouble tap to disconnect BT profile 1.

behaviors.name: Bluetooth Profile 2
behaviors.description: Single quick tap to select the BT profile 2.\nDouble tap to disconnect BT profile 2.

behaviors.name: Bluetooth Profile 3
behaviors.description: Single quick tap to select the BT profile 3.\nDouble tap to disconnect BT profile 3.

behaviors.name: Output Selection
behaviors.description: Allows selecting whether keyboard output is sent to the USB or bluetooth connection when both are connected.

commands.description: Prefer sending to the current bluetooth profile
Prefer sending to USB
Toggle between USB and BLE

behaviors.name: RGB Underglow
behaviors.description: RGB underglow control

commands.description: Toggles the RGB feature on and off
Increases the hue of the RGB feature
Decreases the hue of the RGB feature
Increases the saturation of the RGB feature
Decreases the saturation of the RGB feature
Increases the brightness of the RGB feature
Decreases the brightness of the RGB feature
Increases the speed of the RGB feature effect's animation
Decreases the speed of the RGB feature effect's animation
Cycles the RGB feature's effect forwards
Cycles the RGB feature's effect reverse

behaviors.name: Magic Key
behaviors.description: Tap to show the indicators.\nHold to momentarily change to the Magic Layer.

behaviors.name: Lower Layer Key
behaviors.description: Hold to momentarily change to the Lower Layer.\nDouble-tap to persistently change to the Lower Layer.

behaviors.name: Reset Half
behaviors.description: Reset this half of the keyboard.

behaviors.name: Half Bootloader
behaviors.description: Activate bootloader on this half of the keyboard, allowing you to flash a new firmware.

behaviors.name: Custom Behavior
behaviors.description: Specify the key behavior by text input, to be used in conjunction with Custom Defined Behaviors.

behaviors.name: Mouse Button Press
behaviors.description: Press/release mouse buttons. Requires Advanced Configuration parameter \`HID_POINTING\` set to \`y\`.

behaviors.name: Mouse Move
behaviors.description: Send mouse X/Y movement events. Requires Advanced Configuration parameter \`HID_POINTING\` set to \`y\`.

Move down

Move right

behaviors.name: Mouse Scroll
behaviors.description: Send vertical and horizontal mouse scroll events. Requires Advanced Configuration parameter \`HID_POINTING\` set to \`y\`.

commands.description: Scroll up

configMap.description: Require typing passkey from host to pair BLE connection.
[FIRMWARE > 23.12] When enabled, the advertised BLE device name is appended by the first 6 hexadecimal digits of the serial number.
Latency to use for split central/peripheral connection.
[BETA] Allows overwrite of keys from previously paired hosts. This is useful for connecting with dual-boot hosts.
[BETA] Minimum encryption key size accepted in octets. Must be between 7 and 16.
Enable the Bluetooth BAS (battery reporting service).
Enable full N-key roll over
Enable all consumer key codes, but may have compatibility issues with some host OSes.
[EXPERIMENTAL] Send modifier release event after non-modifier release event. This is available only for PR31, and not yet in production firmware.
[FIRMWARE >= 25.01] Enables mouse emulation capability. [WARNING] Re-pair your keyboard with your host via Bluetooth after enabling this feature.
Enable deep sleep, but may affect BLE reconnection. For detail ZMK documentation see `CONFIG_ZMK_SLEEP`.
Milliseconds of inactivity before entering deep sleep.
Battery level report interval in seconds. For detail ZMK documentation see `CONFIG_ZMK_BATTERY_REPORT_INTERVAL`.
Battery level report interval in seconds. For detail ZMK documentation see `CONFIG_ZMK_BATTERY_REPORT_INTERVAL`.
Maximum number of active combos that use the same key position. For detail ZMK documentation see `CONFIG_ZMK_COMBO_MAX_COMBOS_PER_KEY`.
Maximum number of keys to press to activate a combo. For detail ZMK documentation see `CONFIG_ZMK_COMBO_MAX_KEYS_PER_COMBO`.
Maximum number of behaviors to allow queueing from a macro or other complex behavior. For detail ZMK documentation see `CONFIG_ZMK_BEHAVIORS_QUEUE_SIZE`.
Keyscan press debounce in milliseconds. For detail ZMK documentation see `CONFIG_ZMK_KSCAN_DEBOUNCE_PRESS_MS`.
Keyscan release debounce in milliseconds. For detail ZMK documentation see `CONFIG_ZMK_KSCAN_DEBOUNCE_RELEASE_MS`.
Milliseconds to wait after a setting change before writing it to flash memory

[WARNING] Maps to KConfig variable `CONFIG_BT_LL_SW_LLCP`. Make sure you set `BLE_LL_SW_LLCP_LEGACY` to opposite value. Do not override this unless instructed by MoErgo. Only available in v23.11/v23.12/v24.01.

[WARNING] Maps to KConfig variable `CONFIG_BT_LL_SW_LLCP_LEGACY`. Make sure you set `BLE_LL_SW_LLCP` to opposite value. Do not override this unless instructed by MoErgo. Only available in v23.11/v23.12/v24.01.
[WARNING] Maps to KConfig variable `CONFIG_BT_GATT_AUTO_SEC_REQ`. Do not override unless instructed by MoErgo.
[WARNING] Maps to KConfig variable `CONFIG_BT_AUTO_PHY_UPDATE`. Do not override unless instructed by MoErgo.
[WARNING] Maps to `CONFIG_BT_CTLR_PHY_2M`. Do not override this unless instructed by MoErgo.
[WARNING] For debugging only; do not set this unless instructed by MoErgo. USB Logging is known to cause change in timing-sensitive behavior.
[WARNING] For debugging only; do not set this unless instructed by MoErgo. DEBUG log level is known to cause change in timing-sensitive behavior
[WARNING] For debugging only; do not set this unless instructed by MoErgo.
[WARNING] For debugging only; do not set this unless instructed by MoErgo.
[EXPERIMENTAL] To save battery, turn off the RGB when the keyboard is not used for 30s.
[EXPERIMENTAL] For PR36 community firmware only. Enables per-layer RGB.
